reviews.content:
Got the bike before thanksgiving and managed to get in about 8 rides sandwiched around a bike ride in the Florida keys since. Using Wahoo System off an iPad to control the bike. 
As a previous Wahoo trainer owner I expected the bike to be of top quality and I am not disappointed. Set up to fit me was smooth, easy, and quick. 
I chose a fitness program in Wahoo System and liked it had an evaluation program early on so subsequent rides were based on my current condition, I think. The programs have been interesting and I’ve looked forward to each ride. 
However, I’ve yet to notice the bike tilt and can’t help wonder if I’ve missed something in the settings. The shifting was a bit confusing and took some digging to find out how it was working. Likewise I spent some time researching if I could use my Garmin 1000 to control the bike as I can with my Wahoo trainer with no clear answer. I think the software assumes I know more about that type of program (or have had previous experience with other indoor bikes and systems) than I do. Sometimes I just want to go for a ride and have yet to find where those programs are.
reviews.title: High quality, easy set up, a lot to learn.

reviews.content: Set up is easier than anticipated. After reading a review expressing concerns about thighs rubbing on the top tube I hesitated on purchasing the Kickr. I am 5’ 5”, 122 lbs and male and it has not been an issue at all. Seamless integration with Zwift. Over the past three decades I have used magnetic trainers, fluid trainers with smart technology and another brand of indoor cycle logging thousands of miles. I’m usually very frugal and reluctant to make new purchases, but I have no regrets with this purchase.
reviews.title: No regrets.

reviews.content:
I’ve given 5 stars because the ride experience is just brilliant. Before this I had a Kickr v4 and did 30000 km on it without mishap. I had read about quite a lot of units failing and having to be replaced but after 1200km I’ve had no issues at all. This is the most realistic indoor bike I’ve ridden. I’ve set it up to replicate my outdoor set up and it feels just as comfortable. This is includes the SRAM AXS 12 speed gear configuration which is great.
However that does not mean it is faultless. The seat post and bar post clamps are awful and both slipped badly. The QR bolts are weak and I snapped one trying t get it tight enough. I tried all the fixes recommended but in the end used normal seat post clamps to holds them in the right place. As I don’t share the bike moving them up and down is not an issue. The handlebars feel a bit cheap so I double wrapped them with gel tape which was a great improvement. However on a set up costing £3,000 I would expect better.
reviews.title: Wahoo Kickr Bike

reviews.content:
I have only given the bike 4 stars for the following reasons:
1. The saddle and handle bars are very cheap and need replaced.
2. The computer that shows the gears and connection is very badly placed. difficult to see and in direct line for sweat.

Other than that the bike is amazing, very easy to use, connects really easily and the ride feel is outstanding.

Would definitely recommend if you are happy to put up with the price and that you need to spend more money on a new saddle and possibly handlebars.

reviews.content:
Overall we are thrilled with our KICKR Bike. Training in the winter months, this is about as easy as it can get. Delivery wasn’t entirely smooth but the item was very well packaged. 

Build quality is reasonable, but three aspects jumped out as inferior at $3499 price-point: Shifters are very “plastic fantastic” and don’t feel high quality; shifters have braided cables but lack any ‘cable routing’ — they just dangle in a messy way which is a shame, upgrading the bar tape would be a very nice touch.

In terms of the iOS application - fantastic. Dialing in a fit to match my S-Works Turbo Creo was a doddle, it supports eTap AXS, everything felt perfect on the first ride.

One other miss: KICKR v5 supports a wired network through a recently-released dongle, whereas the KICKR Bike appears to have no ‘dongle port’ so won’t be able to do that.
reviews.title: Very nearly excellent, still extremely good!

reviews.content:
I sold my Kickr Smart Trainer and replaced it with the Kickr Bike about a two months ago. So far I'm loving it. 
Pros: easy set up, quick integration with Zwift, no calibration needed, most realistic feel (especially compared to Peloton and my old bike trainer). 
Cons: Price, handlebar and seat are mediocre quality, and it can be wobbly when standing up on the bike

reviews.content:
Ordered in late November 2019 and received in late Jan 20 - just in time for COVID 19 and work from home life. 

It's the most expensive bike that goes nowhere but can go anywhere virtually. 

The App to set up the bike adjustments gets you close but still requires tweaking. Measurements from actual fitted bikes finished the tweaking to dial in the adjustment setting. I did this for 2 bikes. The handle bar would go out of setting on those hard up hill charges. I eventually found a setting that works for both of us and I tightened it down pretty good. It doesn't move on the hard charges now. 

The attitude changes on the Zwift hills is a great feature and makes it more "real". I have a computer running Zwift and a 27 in monitor at the right height for viewing (KICKR Stand works great for this setup). Overall, it's a great riding experience compared to other trainers. The one thing that took some adjusting was that you never stop pedaling when riding on Zwift. Nothing slows you down so you just keep going like the energizer bunny.

My wife "allowed" the purchase because I was completing my "Gap Year" between retirement and a job that found me. She felt it would provide a better opportunity for me to ride during the Michigan winter because of the new job hours. Keep in mind that I have been riding outside year round for many years but the thought of not having to gear up for 15 minutes prior to riding in the dark at 15 degrees had an appeal so I didn't offer much resistance. 

I started riding and showed my wife the adjustments and Zwift and got her to try it. Guess who rides it more that I do? She was always a fair weather rider (limited to above freezing temps) and likes the variety of rides that Zwift provides. She also listens to podcasts during her ride because the bike is so quiet. Shifting is quick and easy and almost feels like the Dura Ace Di2 on my Trek Domane 6.0 The virtual 11-30 11 speed cassette makes the hills an easier climb but she doesn't have to know I made that adjustment to our road bike (wink).

We are both happy with the purchase even if I was a little alarmed at the 004 serial number. We have had no issues with 2K miles and are now level 20 on Zwift. I would recommend this bike to those who love to ride, can afford it and Zwint, and have the space. You will use it year round especially on those rainy days when the ride outside is possible but it's nicer inside.

When you do get outside, the riding will be a lot easier than Zwift. But the head on a swivel and alertness gets older quickly after mindlessly powering the Zwift riding.
reviews.title: 2K Zwift Miles In 3 Months Without Issue

reviews.content:
I had been waiting for the UK release of this bike for months so good to be able to receive it. The set up was straight forward enough and having rode with a Wahoo Kickr for the last 5 years the first couple of weeks have been interesting re transition. The ride feel is very different to the Kickr which I partly expected given the different technology, I would class the Kickr freewheel set up for me as more reflective of the outdoor ride feel, the new bike feels more Wattbike and is going to take some time to get used to but having ridden over 15k miles on the Wahoo Kickr I have to accept its a different technology.
The incline feel on Zwift is not as marked as I thought it would be having ridden Alpe du Zwift to test it out and the difference in my power output from the Wahoo Kickr to the bike is about 8% different so I need to retest my FTP to bring it into line (the Wahoo Kickr FTP was 313 and the Kickr Bike is around 285, Note though I am at the end of a big block of training do fatigue may be an issue but nonetheless I think the Wahoo Kickr FTP was unrealistic overall as threshold and VO2 efforts on TrainerRoad were unachievable on the Kickr Bike for the last week).
The overall aesthetic is a lot better with the new bike, once I am used to the ride feel I am sure it will be as familiar as the Wahoo Kickr.
reviews.title: New kit and new feel

reviews.content:
I'm glad I have it, really like it, but the craftsmanship is not that of a $3,500 indoor bike. How do I know? Well, my wife has a Peloton bike and that is a top notch piece of equipment. On the Peloton every adjustment knob is smooth and easy to use whereas some of the adjustment knobs in the KICKR require the strength of Hulk to operate them. The Peloton is quite as a feather falling through the air, whereas the KICKR is much louder. Also, the pairing with my Wahoo Element is a bit glitchy.

I don't regret the purchase and I will be keeping it as I do enjoy it enough, but I wanted to be blown away by it and instead it comes across like a second class citizen next to the Peloton.
reviews.title: Good But Not As Good As A Peloton

reviews.content: This can be easily configured (size and group set) for more than one user. It's also a pretty awesome bit of kit! Unfortunately the handlebars slide down when you get out of the Saddle even though they are tightly bound.

reviews.content:
Bike quality is great. But bike is missing ESSENTIAL ANT+ communications features most other trainers have. 

I would have bought it had I known. Wahoo has promised a firmware update to fix it. But still not there. 

So in short don't buy it until cadence and speed/power is transmitted via normal ANT+ and not ANT+ FE-C only. 

It is such a letdown just like the promised update to TickrX to support ANT+ standard running dynamics transmission. (Promised for 3 years now)
reviews.title: Kickr Bike not ready for primetime

reviews.content: I've never been a huge fan of indoor training, but I've been eyeing one of these for a while and I finally decided to pull the trigger just as the COVID-19 lockdowns were starting to come down. I'm glad I did! This makes riding inside so much more enjoyable. The ride realism when paired with an app like Zwift is amazing, and having a dedicated machine so I don't have to swap my bike between inside and outside makes getting on the trainer way less of a hassle. I've only got ~250 miles on it so far, but I'm really enjoying the bike.
reviews.title: Awesome indoor training bike!

reviews.content:
It has been about 10 days my Kickr Bike arrived, and I'm very happy with it. I was a bit skeptical with the design when I saw the pictures, but the actual product looks much better than the pictures in my opinion. 

I see some advantages (and some disadvantages) when compared to a trainer + bike. 
Advantages:
1) the visual appearance, which can be important depending on where you keep your trainer
2) the easy of adjusting the settings, it makes much easier to share the trainer with another user (without having to swap bikes all the time)
3) it's always ready to use (you can achieve this having a bike permanently on the trainer, but it will cost you as much as the Kickr Bike)

Disadvantages:
1) It's no so easy to move it around, if you need to take it out of the way in some occasions. It is probably super difficult if you have to move houses!
2) It does not have a TT/Tri bike setup (but probably extensions bars can be attached to the handlebars)
reviews.title: Excellent trainer (with pros and cons)

reviews.content: After 3 years on a KICKR SNAP using a Virtual Training App (VTA), I made the leap to the BIKE. The problem I have is that The BIKE drops resistance after 2 minutes of "static" use in the VTA. If I change the resistance in the VTA, or change the BIKE tilt, or shift the BIKE, the 2 minute clock starts over. The BIKE works fine in the Wahoo Fitness app, but I bought this for the auto incline and resistance to use with Video Courses.
reviews.title: Compatibility Issues

reviews.content: Set up was pretty straight forward but fit customization was not working on the app. I like being able to set up shifting to mimic every bike. Unit feels sturdy and well built. Ride is smooth and everything seems to work like it should. Gradient changes feel authentic. Shift buttons on inside of hoods seem to be in the way a bit. My thighs touch the top tube a little but it is a great bike.
reviews.title: Great Bike

reviews.content:
Upgraded from a Wahoo Kickr smart trainer, so I'm a fan of their product line. This smart bike is an incredible product – very satisfied. Also, I use exclusively with Zwift.
The Wahoo setup app was very helpful. Used by comparing with my actual Trek road bike to obtain the settings & establish a bike profile based on actual gearing, shifters & crank arm lengths. Easily added Look pedals to match my preference on my Trek. Smart bike settings can be easily tweaked-from seat-post to head-set. Very adjustable & versatile for a smart bike. Impressed.
Virtual shifters are amazingly quick. I did not use the incline simulation with previous smart trainer, but was pleasantly surprised with that feature on this bike. Bike seat can also be replaced! And it's noticeably quiet compared to the KICKR Smart Trainer I was previously using. My family has specifically mentioned this as I ride in the early AM hours while watching PL football on NBCSN – bike, and thus TV, are not disruptive in the household! 
Negatives: Only 1 cage for bottles. But a greater issue for me was that longer water bottles, such as Camelbak Podium Big Chill, don't easily fit with shift cables hooked to the LED Display. Plus, I don't prefer where the LED Display is mounted.
reviews.title: KICKR Smart Bike

reviews.content: My KickrBike arrived yesterday. From the time I started unpacking until I had it paired with the Wahoo app was all of 30 minutes. I took my first ride a bit later, pairing with Zwift to test the climbing feature. Bottom line, works great. I was previously on the Gen3 Kickr, which I thought was very quiet. The bike is equally quiet if not slightly more quiet. Great feeling ride and I particularly like that you get a bit of flex up and down. Bottom line, super happy so far!
reviews.title: New KickrBike!
